TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> What's the policy on rocket pods like the Hydra? Okay or not okay?

Please look at the main thread post :3 That will tell you ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

Do you guys think there will be any more entries? I want to make the brackets soon.

> Do you guys think there will be any more entries? I want to make the brackets soon.

I don't have rocket pods in the OP. That's why I'm wondering if they should be allowed.

Eh, rocket pods are a little underwhelming for air-to-air anyway.

But here's my entry: the **Slamtek Falcon 1-A** fighter/interceptor. [Download link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_FjXR8JXRQZMDNuV18wczRoRFk/view?usp=sharing)

> ![fN3nIO1.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fN3nIO1.jpg)
> ![53hhnnT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/53hhnnT.jpg)

7,188 kg, 36 parts

1x "Whiplash" RamJet

2x AIM-9 (4x2 = 8)

2x Vulcan (Hidden) (9x2 = 18)

2x 20mm Ammo Box (4x2 = 8)

2x Countermeasure Pods (5x2 = 10)

44 points

I guess its up to Pixel for this tourney.
I think I am going to to do double elimination.
It might take a while, depending on how many entrants there are. When I ran the tourney last week it took me a good 8 hours to run all the battles, upload all the videos, and post the results.

Yeah I'm not sure double elimination is a great idea. I don't think there's a point.

My submission for this thing: I proudly present the **Air Frame 82-99**, a knock-down-drag-out scrapper. Because who needs missiles when you have twin GAU-8 cannons?

![tx5UKuT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/tx5UKuT.jpg)

Her vital stats:

11.6 tonnes

44 parts

2x "Whiplash" RamJets

2x GAU-8 30mm (11x2 = 22)

3x 30mm Ammo Box (4x3 = 12)

4x Countermeasure Pod (5x4 = 20)

54 points

A submission for this contest: the **Air Frame 82-92**, a knock-down-drag-out interceptor.

Vital stats:

11.6 tonnes

44 parts

2x whiplash engines

2x GAU-8 30mm (11x2 = 22)

3x 30mm ammo (4x3 = 12)

4x countermeasures (5x4 = 20)

54 points

[http://kerbalx.com/Zixor/Air-Frame-82-99.craft](http://kerbalx.com/Zixor/Air-Frame-82-99.craft)

You might want to lower the default altitude. From my experience, the plane to reach altitude first, usually wins, because it forces the other plane to go defensive.

Of course, with a high default altitude, your plane won't have any chance of smashing into the ground. Until it loses its wing, at least.

> 
> You might want to lower the default altitude. From my experience, the plane to reach altitude first, usually wins, because it forces the other plane to go defensive.
> Of course, with a high default altitude, your plane won't have any chance of smashing into the ground. Until it loses its wing, at least.

It depends on how you start the fight. If you start them close together, the plane that turns to fight first has a huge advantage. If you start them spread a kilometer apart, then it doesn't seem to make much difference.

Hmm ok. See, it uses experimental maneuverability boost systems so that it can fly after taking one missle hit. The issue is the AI still is terrible at controlling it, so it can't react fast to the ground. Also, it climbs to that altitude in at most 20 seconds. The last time I lowered the altitude, it hit the mountain range behind the KSC.

> 
> Hmm ok. See, it uses experimental maneuverability boost systems so that it can fly after taking one missle hit. The issue is the AI still is terrible at controlling it, so it can't react fast to the ground. Also, it climbs to that altitude in at most 20 seconds. The last time I lowered the altitude, it hit the mountain range behind the KSC.

We usually have the fights right next to the KSC so the mountains shouldn't be a problem. 

But you can keep it high. t3hJimmer is right. It doesn't make a huge difference.
Also could someone download it and check if it has wheels?

> 
> Also could someone download it and check if it has wheels?

Yep, d/l'd and checked, it does have landing gear. I'm gonna test it against a few of mine if you don't mind ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Edit: Ran your Peregrine against my Falcon a couple times... I won't spoil the results ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
